citation.article-title: Helcobacillus massiliensis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel representative of the family Dermabacteraceae isolated from a patient with a cutaneous discharge
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Helcobacillus (Hel.co.ba.cil′lus. Gr. n. helkos, wound; L. masc. n. bacillus, rod; N.L. masc. n. Helcobacillus, a rod found in wounds).
Essentially aerobic but may show very weak growth under anaerobic conditions.
Acid is produced from glucose and some other sugars.
Starch and aesculin are not hydrolysed.
Activities of N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, pyrazinamidase and α-glucosidase are detected.
Predominant cellular fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 (34.3 %), anteiso-C17 : 0 (18.7 %) and iso-C16 : 0 (18.6 %).
Polar lipids are phosphatidylglycerol, diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylcholine and unidentified glycolipids (phospholipid pattern III).
The isomer of DAP is meso-Dpm.
Analysis of whole-cell sugars reveals high amounts of galactose, ribose and some glucose.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type species is 68.6 mol%.
The type species is Helcobacillus massiliensis.
